channel.title: Android tablet
channel.description:
I will be getting my back-taxes tomorrow so I am looking to get a cheap android tablet that will have a GPU and CPU (1ghz) so that I can play more graphic intensive games etc. I have found this one so far. My budget is not very high at all but I am just looking for suggestions.
http://www.ebay.com/itm/V7-7-Capacitive-multi-touch-Android-2-3-VC882-Cortex-A8-Tablet-PC-512MB-4GB-4g-/270859914360?pt=AU_Tablets&hash=item3f10824c78
inb4ipad.
New one I'm looking at: http://www.ebay.com/itm/8-Herotab-MID816-Cortex-A8-1-2Ghz-Samsung-S5PV210-Capacitive-Tablet-Android-2-3-/250947953186?pt=US_Tablets&hash=item3a6da9e222

item.title: Android tablet
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

I looked at the Kindle Fire shortly after I caught word of it running android. I saw it had custom ROM’s but the main fact there is no MicroSD slot, or any slot for expandable memory, turns me away immediately. Just not worth it to me lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Android tablet
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

I just remembered the kindle fire is supposed to be good. i havent played with 1 before but they are $50 less than the acer idk how they compare to each other. heres a benchmark of the fire http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P_SOB0c2Zok you can flash cyanogenmod on the fire. and here is a thread about the 2 tablet at xda http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=1367607

item.title: Android tablet
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

My poor internet speed prevents any quality streaming so I rely on MicroSD cards and USB thumb drives. I looked into it a while back while I still had decent speed but never really saw a use for it as I can always carry around an extra microsd. I have 4 8GB sd cards for my PSP, 2 I bought, and 2 were given to me. All are full of pirated and UMD ripped games. I tend to have a way with SD card to not loose them.

EDIT: After noticing the Acer has a dual core 1GHz processor, and the Levono has a single core. I will go with the Acer. Got a guy comming to look at my motorcycle tomorrow, hopefully he buys it. If so I’ll pick up the Acer from bestbuy on friday.

Read full topic

item.title: Android tablet
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:29, topic:431320”]Well, for $20 more than the Ebay priced Lenovo with that much of an upgrade, nothing to complain lol. Really hoping I sell my motorcycle tomorrow now. The main downside is the 8GB less internal storage but, really, when does an Android user use that much. I can always go out and buy a 16GB micro.

I’ll do some further research before I order but I guess I’ll just put out the bit of extra, although its going to kill me bill-side.[/quote]
also you can always use dropbox and hook multiple accounts up through sharing folders between multiple accounts. and if you were wanting to have music you can get google music if you dont already have it. ive been wanting to find away to host videos online so i can watch them over the internet without needing it in my phone. i tried youtube but they knew it was copyright material, I had it private so only i could see it.

edit: just thinking about it you could probably have it on a site where you can get the direct link like dropbox, uppit, msn skydrive and then watch it through some video player where you can watch streaming video. but if you only used it at home there are apps out there that let you stream video and music to your android devices but im sure you know that since you’ve had more android devices than me.

Read full topic

item.title: Android tablet
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Well, for $20 more than the Ebay priced Lenovo with that much of an upgrade, nothing to complain lol. Really hoping I sell my motorcycle tomorrow now. The main downside is the 8GB less internal storage but, really, when does an Android user use that much. I can always go out and buy a 16GB micro.

I’ll do some further research before I order but I guess I’ll just put out the bit of extra, although its going to kill me bill-side.

Read full topic

has a 3.0 Mp
16gb SSD built in
plus 32gb expandable storage
also has a8 card

and which acer iconia?
most of them are over 400 dollars o-o[/quote]
sorry i had it typed up and sent it and it said there were posts in front of me. I already posted the link to the acer iconia in like my first post.

here are the tablets compared to each other: http://www.bestbuy.com/site/olspage.jsp?id=cat13504&type=page&pageIdentity=searchDriven&useProductString=true&productString=12183886723981218435211144&unProductString=121842593928512184351642321218421825084121837088509812183234270731218454592635121841271069412184218694031218361851397121832739790212185152249911218505326856*1218498015417&catId= the lenovo is $60 cheaper and has 16gb instead of 8gb but the iconia beats in in like everything else.

item.title: Android tablet
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:26, topic:431320”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=533997.msg3904378#msg3904378 date=1328068208]

you did not read what i just posted o-o
30 dollar more than yours it has better in
has a 3.0 Mp
16gb SSD built in
plus 32gb storage
also has a8 card

and which acer iconia?
most of them are over 400 dollars o-o

Watching a review on the Lenovo right now, seems it does have issues after hours of continuous use, but that is normal with most devices. My PSP even gives problems after 4-5 hours lol. Other than that, if I do sell my motorcycle tomorrow I may just get it.

Edit: Well here are points++ to the Lenovo, it does come with Android market built in, many of the ones I looked at you had to install it yourself lol.
[/quote]
apktop.com and 4shared.com
Get paid apps for free
and how much is your motocycle worth? o-o[/quote]
The motorcycle I am selling is a budget bike even when new lol. New it was $4995 off the showroom floor. I am (hopefully) getting $700 for it as is. If I put in all the work I had originally planned it would be worth about $2500-$3000 though. Just, never managed to find a replacement set of plastics so that I could start.

Also, for once, on Android I only pirate things when they are not compatible or expensively priced. If its just because of the price I do typically buy it if I have the money.

Read full topic

item.title: Android tablet
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:13, topic:431320”]My only problem with your argument is looks can be deceiving lol. You say ren, buy I will assume you mean yen, and the conversion of 1500 yen to USD is around $20 if my brain deceives me. You just sound like more of a ‘well i have this an its good’ rather than a ‘looks decent but this may be better for the money’ kinda person.

EDIT: You said china so my mistake, Yen is the Japanese currency. You meant Yuan, still the conversion is closer to $240 or so USD.[/quote]no i meant ren. renminbi look it up lul.
and at xyryz also look up ren it is short for renminbi (official chinese currency)
Yes the newest one http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wN9MSTvZffM same exact 1

Read full topic
